about_the_game:
In the Obscurity State Demo, you will play as one of the marauders who has ventured into an abandoned city in search of a mysterious artifact. Your main objective in the demo is to retrieve this artifact and escape the city. Additionally, you can complete personal quests based on what you encounter along the way, interact with other players through in-game voice chat, and experiment with the fire-starting mechanic to ignite the environment and enemies.

The gameplay takes place within a location featuring several residential blocks with small interiors and a large local hospital building, all designed in the style of a 1990s American provincial town.

This demo has been released to gather as much feedback as possible about our project, address shortcomings, and consider suggestions. So don’t hesitate to comment and share your thoughts!

You start the game alone. You don’t know exactly where you are, and you have no idea who you might encounter along the way. What to expect from another marauder — does he have a weapon? What are his intentions? — all of this will determine whether you become allies or enemies.

Someone has ensured that stealing the artifact won’t be easy for marauders like you. Use a lighter and a canister of fuel to achieve your goals — burn everything and everyone in your path.

Monsters and items change their locations in every game session — you can never be sure what awaits behind the next door or around the next corner. The dense fog covering the city makes things even more difficult, limiting your ability to navigate. So be ready to rely on your intuition… or sheer luck.

FULL GAME

In the full version of the game, we will add:

  • The ability to play with up to 8 players

  • An in-game store where you can purchase useful items, skins, and character animations using in-game currency

  • Randomized locations for each new game session

  • A unique sound propagation mechanic that will affect your strategy and playstyle

Stay tuned for updates — we’ll be launching the full game’s page soon!

content_descriptors.notes: This game contains content that may be inappropriate for some audiences. It features humanoid monsters, graphic depictions of violence, blood effects, and frightening sounds, all in the context of a horror experience. Players should expect intense combat scenarios, disturbing imagery, and unsettling audio designed to create a chilling atmosphere.

legal_notice:
Legal Disclaimer for Demo Version


This is a demo version of the game, and as such, it may contain bugs, performance issues, or incomplete features. All art, assets, code, and other intellectual property used in this game have been either legally purchased or created in-house.

We welcome any feedback, suggestions, or reports regarding bugs or issues. If you encounter any problems or have proposals for improvement, please don't hesitate to contact us. We are committed to addressing concerns as quickly as possible.

Please note that this demo is for testing and feedback purposes only, and the content is subject to change in the final release. The distribution, reproduction, or modification of this game without prior permission is prohibited.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10, 64 Bit 64bit OS required
  • Processor: Intel Core i3 or AMD Ryzen 3
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: For 1080p: Geforce GTX 1650, Radeon RX 5300
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
  • Sound Card: Yes
  • VR Support: no
  • Additional Notes: Mouse, Keyboard, Microphone for team communication

short_description: In this demo, you can experience the core concept of Obscurity State. This is a cooperative survival horror game that allows 2-4 players to play simultaneously. Form alliances or rivalries with other players, fight monsters, complete personal objectives, and master the fire-starting mechanic.
